title.text: A bidirectional mapping between English and CNF-based reasoners

abstractContent.text: If language is a transduction between sound and meaning, the target of semantic interpretation should be the meaning representation expected by general cognition.
Automated rea-soners provide the best available fully-explicit proxies for general cognition, and they commonly expect Clause Normal Form (CNF) as input.
There is a well-known algorithm for converting from unrestricted predicate calculus to CNF, but it is not invertible, leaving us without a means to transduce CNF back to En-glish.
I present a solution, with possible repercussions for the overall framework of semantic interpretation.
